com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface CleartextCredentialService2

All Superinterfaces:
Service
public interface CleartextCredentialService2
extends Service

CleartextCredentialService permits an Agent to request Credentials from the FMS. It is preferred that Agents use one of the established ConnectionServices when authenticating to a remote resource but may request Credentials directly if the required connection type is not yet implemented. Agents must be cautious about handling the returned Credential objects as their attributes are unencrypted and should not be cached or reused between authentication attempts.

Since:
5.5.5.5

Method Detail

createEvent

CredentialEvent createEvent()
Creates a new empty CredentialEvent that can be used to submit Credential Events to the Server without associating a Credential with them.

Returns:
CredentialEvent

createEvent

CredentialEvent createEvent(Credential credential)
Creates a new CredentialEvent for a Credential. You can use this to customize the event parameters and add tags or properties to the event to be processed by the Server

Parameters:
credential - The Credential that the event will be created for.
Returns:
CredentialEvent

createEvent

CredentialEvent createEvent(Credential credential,
                            CredentialQueryResultSet query)
Creates a new CredentialEvent for a Credential and its associated Query. You can use this to customize the event parameters and add tags or properties to the event to be processed by the Server

Parameters:
credential - The Credential that the event will be created for.
query - The Credential Query Results that is associated with this event
Returns:
CredentialEvent that is associated with the CredentialQuery

createEvent

CredentialEvent createEvent(CredentialQueryResultSet query)
Creates a CredentialEvent without associating a Credential to the event. Can be used to notify the server that a connection failed due to no returned credentials.

Parameters:
query - The Credential Query Results that is associated with this event
Returns:
CredentialEvent that is associated with the CredentialQuery

notifyEvent

void notifyEvent(CredentialEvent event)
Sends an event to the Credential Manager

Parameters:
event - To dispatch

queryCredentials

void queryCredentials(CredentialQuery2 query,
                      CredentialQueryResultCallback2 results)
Requests a set of credential objects from the defined query. The result of the credential query will be returned to the agent implemented CredentialQueryResultCallback2 class. Calls to the query service will run asynchronously.

Parameters:
query - definition
results - callback impl to handle results

registerCredentialValidator

void registerCredentialValidator(java.lang.String scheme,
                                 CredentialValidator validator)
Called by the connection services when their agent has requested that it be included in credential testing. The agent that implements this is expected to store the test callback somewhere. When the user issues a test with this agent FglAM will retrieve the test and execute it. The agent will then be given an opportunity to work with the connection while it is open to ensure that it is usable.

Parameters:
scheme - The URI scheme to be associated with this validator. See URI.getScheme() for value specifications.
validator - The test object itself

reportConnectionFailure

void reportConnectionFailure(java.lang.String host,
                             Credential credential,
                             CredentialQueryResultSet query,
                             java.lang.String[] tags,
                             java.lang.Throwable e)
Dispatches a Credential Event should a credential fail to authenticate the remote connection

Parameters:
host - destination for connection
credential - used to authenticate
query - that returned the credential
tags - associated with this event
e - error that was encountered
Since:
5.6.2.2

reportConnectionSuccess

void reportConnectionSuccess(java.lang.String host,
                             Credential credential,
                             CredentialQueryResultSet query,
                             java.lang.String[] tags)
Dispatches a Credential Event when a successful connection has been made

Parameters:
host - that was connected to
credential - used to authenticate
query - that returned the credential
tags - associated with this event
Since:
5.6.2.2

validateCredentialPolicies

boolean validateCredentialPolicies(Credential credential,
                                   CredentialQueryResultSet query)
Checks the Credential's Policies to ensure that the credential is valid and can be used to authenticate a connection

Parameters:
credential - Credential to validate policies
query - The Query that returned this Credential
Returns:
true if the Credential's Policy validation check passed
Since:
5.6.2.2
